alert.note: Alert for Apple and Lucerne Valleys; Coachella Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 23 at 1:46PM PST until December 24 at 6:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following areas, Apple and Lucerne Valleys, Coachella Valley and San Diego County Deserts. * WHEN...From Midnight PST tonight through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An atmospheric river will bring widespread rainfall. The heaviest rainfall is expected from after midnight into Friday morning with total rainfall through Friday of 1 to 1.5 inches locally up to 2 inches. This could lead to flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Apple and Lucerne Valleys; Coachella Valley
